channel.title: tastytrade: Options Jive
channel.description: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn to talk the talk - sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss trading topics of the day.
channel.itunes:author: tastytrade
channel.itunes:summary: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.googleplay:author: tastytrade, Inc.

item.title: The Ebb and Flow of the VIX
item.description: The hawkish stance from the Fed on Nov. 24 was the backdrop, but the emergence of the omicron Covid-19 variant was the real impetus for the recent increase in volatility. How does this rise compare to the others seen this year? Join @jermalchandler, Tom and @Tony Battista as they explain.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The hawkish stance from the Fed on Nov. 24 was the backdrop, but the emergence of the omicron Covid-19 variant was the real impetus for the recent increase in volatility. How does this rise compare to the others seen this year? Join @jermalchandle...
item.content:encoded: The hawkish stance from the Fed on Nov. 24 was the backdrop, but the emergence of the omicron Covid-19 variant was the real impetus for the recent increase in volatility. How does this rise compare to the others seen this year? Join @jermalchandler, Tom and @Tony Battista as they explain.

item.title: How Volatile Are Earnings Days?
item.description:
When trading on earnings days, it would be helpful to have a contextual understanding of the underlying price moves that come on earnings days compared to non-earnings days.

So in this segment we ask: how much more volatile are the price moves on earnings days vs any other day? Tom and Tony dig into the stats to find out.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle:
When trading on earnings days, it would be helpful to have a contextual understanding of the underlying price moves that come on earnings days compared to non-earnings days.
So in this segment we ask: how much more volatile are the price moves on...
item.content:encoded:
When trading on earnings days, it would be helpful to have a contextual understanding of the underlying price moves that come on earnings days compared to non-earnings days.

So in this segment we ask: how much more volatile are the price moves on earnings days vs any other day? Tom and Tony dig into the stats to find out.

item.title: ITM Put vs. Covered Call
item.description:
ITM Puts and Covered calls offer us the exact same portfolio exposure--so then why choose one over the other? tastytrade digs into where the differences lie.

And check out the Market Measures Some Stats About Covered Calls segment to see us backtest two strategies to see how returns would have looked in the past 15 years!
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle:

And check out the Market Measures Some Stats About Covered Calls segment to see us backt...

ITM Puts and Covered calls offer us the exact same portfolio exposure--so then why choose one over the other? tastytrade digs into where the differences lie.

And check out the Market Measures Some Stats About Covered Calls segment to see us backtest two strategies to see how returns would have looked in the past 15 years!

item.title: Ominous Volatility Signals
item.description:
Volatility remains elevated due to the Fed’s shift toward less generous monetary settings AND uncertainty surrounding how the omicron outbreak will affect the economy.  

And Wednesday’s session had a larger intraday rally from the previous day’s close and then ended down on the day. Since 1990 there have only been 17 other sessions where that happened. What does all of this mean?
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Volatility remains elevated due to the Fed’s shift toward less generous monetary settings AND uncertainty surrounding how the omicron outbreak will affect the economy. And Wednesday’s session had a larger intraday rally from the previous day’s clo...
item.content:encoded:
Volatility remains elevated due to the Fed’s shift toward less generous monetary settings AND uncertainty surrounding how the omicron outbreak will affect the economy.  

And Wednesday’s session had a larger intraday rally from the previous day’s close and then ended down on the day. Since 1990 there have only been 17 other sessions where that happened. What does all of this mean?

item.title: Profits From Short Options
item.description: There are several ways an option that has been sold short can turn a profit. Join Tom and Tony as they cover each of these factors to help you understand the strategy behind the trades we place.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: There are several ways an option that has been sold short can turn a profit. Join Tom and Tony as they cover each of these factors to help you understand the strategy behind the trades we place.
item.content:encoded: There are several ways an option that has been sold short can turn a profit. Join Tom and Tony as they cover each of these factors to help you understand the strategy behind the trades we place.

item.title: COVID Stock Correlation
item.description: tastytrade looks at the stocks that remained resilient to the COVID news on Friday and their correlation to each other, as well as SPY over the last three months to see if Friday was a fluke, or if there is historical evidence for this non (or inverse) correlation.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: tastytrade looks at the stocks that remained resilient to the COVID news on Friday and their correlation to each other, as well as SPY over the last three months to see if Friday was a fluke, or if there is historical evidence for this non (or inv...

item.title: Strangle Correlations
item.description:
One of the key tenets of strategic premium selling is using a high number of occurrences to reduce variance. But more trades only count as more occurrences when they are uncorrelated. 

The correlations between underlyings are readily available to traders, but tastytrade looks to see how these correlations relate to the ones that really matter to us: the correlations of options.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: One of the key tenets of strategic premium selling is using a high number of occurrences to reduce variance. But more trades only count as more occurrences when they are uncorrelated. The correlations between underlyings are readily available to t...
item.content:encoded:
One of the key tenets of strategic premium selling is using a high number of occurrences to reduce variance. But more trades only count as more occurrences when they are uncorrelated. 

The correlations between underlyings are readily available to traders, but tastytrade looks to see how these correlations relate to the ones that really matter to us: the correlations of options.

item.title: IV on Non-Equity Products
item.description:
Many options traders look to use IV as the basis of entering trades, but can this be used on non-equity products such as GLD?

Non-equity ETFs like GLD and TLT have historically had lower volatility than equity ETFs such as SPY. What does a “high” IV look like for GLD, TLT, and SLV?
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Many options traders look to use IV as the basis of entering trades, but can this be used on non-equity products such as GLD? Non-equity ETFs like GLD and TLT have historically had lower volatility than equity ETFs such as SPY. What does a “high” ...
item.content:encoded:
Many options traders look to use IV as the basis of entering trades, but can this be used on non-equity products such as GLD?

Non-equity ETFs like GLD and TLT have historically had lower volatility than equity ETFs such as SPY. What does a “high” IV look like for GLD, TLT, and SLV?

item.title: Digging into the SPY and IV Correlation
item.description:
The SPY and VIX have always been negatively correlated, meaning that when SPY makes a move, VIX tends to go in the opposite direction.

Tom and Tony dig into the details of this correlation.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The SPY and VIX have always been negatively correlated, meaning that when SPY makes a move, VIX tends to go in the opposite direction. Tom and Tony dig into the details of this correlation.
item.content:encoded:
The SPY and VIX have always been negatively correlated, meaning that when SPY makes a move, VIX tends to go in the opposite direction.

Tom and Tony dig into the details of this correlation.

item.title: What's the Dollar Got to Do With It
item.description:
The U.S. Dollar has been in demand recently as it's currently sitting near 16-month highs. The dollar is particularly useful for traders in the bond, currency and gold markets. For example, a strong USD is typically correlated with falling gold prices.

While there are a multitude of ways to trade the dollar, the best pure plays are the Small Dollar Futures and the US Dollar Index Bullish Fund UUP.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they take a look at the different ways to trade the U.S. Dollar.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The U.S. Dollar has been in demand recently as it's currently sitting near 16-month highs. The dollar is particularly useful for traders in the bond, currency and gold markets. For example, a strong USD is typically correlated with falling gold pr...
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Dollar has been in demand recently as it's currently sitting near 16-month highs. The dollar is particularly useful for traders in the bond, currency and gold markets. For example, a strong USD is typically correlated with falling gold prices.

While there are a multitude of ways to trade the dollar, the best pure plays are the Small Dollar Futures and the US Dollar Index Bullish Fund UUP.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they take a look at the different ways to trade the U.S. Dollar.

item.title: Trading Neutral
item.description: The selling price of a security is the point at which buyers and sellers meet. If the price stays constant at this point it is said to be a neutral market. With options, we can set up trades that profit from non-movement. Join Tom and Tony today as they explain in detail!
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.title: Tradable Crypto Products
item.description:
With the crypto market closing at $2.6 trillion and volatility stabilizing, the number of tradable products in the space has rapidly increased as well.

On tastyworks, there are 21 spot cryptos to trade (from the long side), two bitcoin CME futures (standard and micro size), one Small Exchange future, and two bitcoin ETFs with options that have relatively decent liquidity.

On tastyworks, there are 21 spot cryptos to trade (from the long side), two bitcoin CME futures (standard and micro size), one Small Exchange future, and two bitcoin ETFs with options that have relatively decent liquidity.

item.title: The Hidden Risk of Iron Condors
item.description: When smaller accounts become big enough to take on more risk, should we increase the number of iron condors we sell? Or widen the long wings out and/or go undefined? Tom and Tony discuss the hidden risk of Iron Condor.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: When smaller accounts become big enough to take on more risk, should we increase the number of iron condors we sell? Or widen the long wings out and/or go undefined? Tom and Tony discuss the hidden risk of Iron Condor.

item.title: Five Pertinent Grapics for Q4 2021 and Beyond
item.description:
Nearly 86% of S&P 500 stocks have reported earnings and there are only seven weeks left in 2021. There have been several themes in the market this year but these five graphics are pertinent now and could define the rest of the year and the beginning of 2022.

Join Tony, TP, and Jermal as they examine these five pertinent graphics for Q4 2021 and beyond.
